meanings.definition: To undervalue or underestimate the worth of something.
meanings.sent1: She kept misprizing her own talents, not realizing how special they were.
meanings.sent2: He was always misprizing the efforts of his teammates, never acknowledging their hard work.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to misprize the new toy, preferring the old one instead.
meanings.sent4: Her misprizing of the antique vase led her to accidentally break it.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's constant misprizing of his students' abilities discouraged them from trying their best.

meanings.definition: To have a low opinion of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Despite his misprizing of the movie, she still enjoyed it immensely.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help misprizing the new student until she got to know him better.
meanings.sent3: The dog's misprizing of the new dog food made his owner laugh at his picky behavior.
meanings.sent4: His misprizing of the book cover led him to miss out on a great story inside.
meanings.sent5: The boss's constant misprizing of his employees created a negative work environment.

meanings.definition: To fail to appreciate or recognize the value of something.
meanings.sent1: She was misprizing the beauty of the sunset by staring at her phone.
meanings.sent2: He regretted misprizing the importance of spending time with his family.
meanings.sent3: The child's misprizing of the handmade gift hurt his grandmother's feelings.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs was a clear case of misprizing the potential danger.
meanings.sent5: The traveler's misprizing of the local cuisine caused him to miss out on delicious meals.
